page.title: 12Population Change:Chinnor et
page.content: Chinnor has experienced tremendous growth in the last 20 years and now has a population of some 6,000. Two new primary schools were built to accomodate all the young children. Population: 1961-1,500; 1971-4,500; 1984-6,000 In contrast, Sydenham and Emmington remained fairly stable during this time. Several Sydenham families in 1843 were given financial assistance to emigrate to Australia to alleviate problems of poverty and unemployment in an area wholly dependent on agriculture. Population then was 437; later this dropped to 392. In 1971, there were 305 people; in 1981, 339. Emmington families also emigrated to Australia and for the same reason- agricultural depression. Population: 1851-104; 1861-88; 1950-46; 1985-55 approx.
